data.title: Good food and service
data.text: Agio has terrific food and the service is excellent!  The patio is small but its nice to sit outside while we still can. There selection of salads, appetizer and specials of the day are all good!

data.title: HAVING A CATERED PARTY??? LOOK NO FURTHER!!
data.text: I had the most wonderful experience with Mike at Agio - very helpful and patient with me when I was deciding on what food to have. His advice was perfect!  The food  was wonderful and delivered right on time!  I would highly recommend them!!

data.title: Nice Place
data.text: Reasonable service. Nice atmosphere. Seafood stuffed petite pumpkin was different and a treat. The fried calamari was overcooked. Do not see veal picatta often so gave it a try. Found it to be slightly overcooked as well. Tiramisu was ordered and was quiet good, but I like a little more of the strong coffee taste. Overall not bad, but it is pricey.

data.title: Good food in a nice local venue.
data.text: Good food , large portions, nice wine list and attentive service.  White tablecloths , no loud music . I had the lasagne and the carrot cake both would be highly recommended.

data.title: Great food
data.text: While it's a really nice restaurant in the middle of Palatine, it is not a spur of the moment dining out since it is somewhat overpriced

data.title: So good...
data.text:
I keep coming back because I have never been disappointed. Seeing these other reviews I wonder if they were submitted by owners of competitive establishments. 

This place goes far and wide to find great ingredients. hello... sauteed halibut cheeks?!

 Very friendly staff and they aren't afraid to make something special for you. 

It's also nice to just sit at the bar. The wine selection is very thoughtful and Leo is a fine bartender/server who is quick and knowledgable. 

A beautiful space inside and out should you choose to dine al fresco. In Italian, Agio means "to be comfortable and at ease". It's a feeling and an apt moniker.

data.title: Down a notch
data.text:
Visiting friends we decided to try Agio again.  But alas.  Same boring menu as reported the last time.  Same boring bread.   Is there no innovation, creativity?   Feels like the long slow coast on autopilot. 
Service is friendly, helpful.  Kitchen screwed up entree.  Wait staff put into terrible position.  Luckily did not defend what happened.  
Improvements can be made.  Will they attempt to change?  
Might never know.

data.title: Average Fair
data.text: The food was pretty good but the restaurant was loud (spill over from the bar) and not appropriate for a quiet dinner.  The service was OK.  It was a bit expensive for what it offered.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Food ok service mediocre! Decent food in a very nice setting. Calamari appetizer was bland but huge portion. Typical fried calamari with marinara sauce absolutely plain and nothing special. Followed by the penne pasta & tenderloin with a light cream sauce which was tasty and good sized portion. Everything was fine for us here although we found the service a little lacking. Not impressed when you are told specials or offered after dinner drinks and not told the prices. I find it irritating to have to ask.

data.title: Great from Cocktails thru Entree
data.text: First time visit for this establishment and it did not disappoint.  Visit was early Sunday evening and it was bustling with Father's day families.  Started with cocktails and were not rushed thru any of the courses.  Remember those days!  Bruschetta appetizer that's enough for two,  Capresse salad and finished with Grouper dinner.  All perfectly presented and delicious.  Definitely will return!

data.title: Bday bash.
data.text:
Went to this restaurant on a Thursday night
Had made reservation 10 days early 
Was seated next to big party who got all of the attention 
Service was poor took a long time to get drinks and food 
Food is pricey 
Draw a line thru this choice

data.title: Strip Mall Find
data.text:
We started our meal with hot fresh baked bread, which is always a plus.  My wife and I split a Caprese salad.  The mozzarella was creamy and tomatoes had a sweet taste to them.  For entrees my wife had the Chicken Marsala with pasta.  The chicken and Marsala sauce were excellent.  The wine sauce did not over power the chicken.  The only issue was the pasta was a bit over cooked and chewy.  I had the Meat Lasagna, which was excellent.  Just the right mix of meat and cheese, with sauce.  The portion was actually large enough to share, but I ate it all.  For desert my wife had the spumoni gelato and I had the wildberry sorbetto.  Both hit the spot.
Our only complaint was that we were seated in what appeared to be a finished patio area.  We would have much preferred to be in the main part of the restaurant, and when we go back we will request that.

data.title: Wonderful Neighborhood Restaurant
data.text: For authentic Italian food at reasonable prices with good service, try Agio's Italian Bistro in Palatine.  Everything is prepared fresh.  The tomato sauce is terrific, and there are always daily specials.  Lunch is a great value with many selections and combinations. Tthe atmosphere in the restaurant is delightful, and, in warm weather, there is an enclosed outdoor patio which is pleasant.

data.title: Easter Champagne Brunch - a little disappointing
data.text:
We went to Agio's Italian Bistro for the first time today to try their Easter Champagne Brunch.  It's an interesting, smaller restaurant, decorated nicely.  Based on the number of wine bottles in the floor-to-ceiling rack, imbibers should find whatever they are looking for.  We were seated quickly and offered Mimosas or just Champagne to start.  The Bloody Marys were $5 extra (and not very good).  We were directed to a far corner where the small buffet was set up.  Peel and eat shrimp, smoked salmon/capers/onions/cream cheese and mini bagels; a smattering of hot dishes, a carving station, some breakfast offerings, etc.  Omelets cooked back in the kitchen.  Desserts were OK; the light cheesecake squares with sliced almonds and the chocolate-covered strawberries were good.
All in all, it was just OK.  Some of the food was dry, some not even warm.  Not much different than what you could have found at most any $10-12 buffets.  Nothing comes to mind that really stood out.  Fresh, warm bread served at the table would have been nice.  Whipped butter would have been nice.  Side plates to put shrimp shells and/or the missing warm bread on would have been nice.  Fancy jellies would have been nice.
The Easter Champagne Brunch almost seemed like an after-thought.  I can imagine that on a regular dinner night out, the meal might be better than what we experienced today...maybe a little more personalized, a little fresher, a little warmer.  Service was OK.  Really no complaints in that department.  But at $29.95 + tax + tip, I expected better.  Will we return?  Probably not.

data.title: Delicious Italian Dining
data.text: Beautiful ambiance and delicious food close to home. We celebrated a special birthday and the food & service was excellent!

data.title: Used to love it, but now I hate it
data.text: I used to go here about once every two weeks or so until I had a really unpleasant experience. We were eating at the bar and ordered the mussels, which when brought out smelled a little off. I asked the waiter if they smelled "right" and he said that he thought so. I tried one, then had my mouth fill with some sort of sewer slug flavor that lingers with me til this day. I told the manager (who was the owner's son that day) about the bad mussels and he basically said: "Yeah, I know, they should take them off of the menu." After that there were no apologies, and no offer to substitute them for another dish. I had to ask them not to bill me for the returned dish. Making matters worse, we didn't receive any other help from that point on and decided to leave. I haven't been back since. The food is normally good, and I understand that mussels can be tricky at times, but for them to know that they're selling food that can kill you and they're gambling with it, really rubs me the wrong way--especially when we got attitude from them after bringing it t their attention. I haven't been back since.

data.title: Great Food!!!
data.text: It is a great restaurant with great food. Its like home cooking. And the atmosphere is fantastic. We always have a great time when we are in the restaurant. They have a nice outside area in the spring summer and fall.

data.title: terrible
data.text: wouldn't go here if I got a free meal!!  The manager was on the phone calling the police because I questioned the bill Food is good but pricey

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Excellent, authentic Italian. Pasta was home made. Delicious. The sauce was very authentic home made like grand mother would make. This is a nice place to celebrate an Occassion as the ambience is very nice. Highly recommend!

data.title: Very reasonable Italian
data.text:
Went with six other friends ambience and decor top notch
Had Italian sausage and peppers and calamari both excellent
Couldn't believe how inexpensive the menu was veal Marsala $14 I have paid $24 for similar portion
Pasta dishes 13-14 along with chicken
All came with sides of pasta
Highly recommend this place no wonder it was packed
